drupalNodeEvent.title: China Studies Book Club - Peter Lavelle, "The Profits of Nature: Colonial Development and the Quest for Resources in Nineteenth Century China"

field_speakers.processed: Host: Professor Kent Guy (China Studies Book Club steering committee)

field_organizers.processed: China Studies Program, The Henry M. Jackson School of International Studies, University of Washington

field_description.processed: Fifth Meeting: Peter Lavelle, "The Profits of Nature: Colonial Development and the Quest for Resources in Nineteenth Century China" (Columbia UP 2020). Every year lots of great books about China get published, books that deserve to be widely read and discussed. Book reviews are helpful, but take months or even years to come out. To make it easier for China scholars to discuss with each other some of the recent English-language books they are reading, the University of Washington China Studies Program has started a virtual China Studies Book Club. We think it will be fun to have conversations about books we find exciting, provocative, or moving and invite China scholars elsewhere to join us.
